page.title: 13BIRTHDAY
page.content: My name is Linda Houston and here is my account of how I spent Sunday 23rd June 1985. I began the day in the Cranfield Church Hall on the last day of our Girls' Brigade camp. I was wakened at 9.00am and had breakfast. Some of my friends and I went for a walk and played games until 10.30am when we walked back to the hall for our morning service. Before Rev. McGaughey our minister arrived, everyone sang "Happy Birthday" to me as I was twelve years old. My friends then gave me the birthday bumps. After the service I checked all my clothes were in my case and got ready to go back to Kilkeel. My parents picked me up at the church hall and we went home in time for lunch. At about 2.30pm I opened my cards and presents, some of which were very welcome surprises. Around 3.30pm
